intro: Quiina lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf quiina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or marshy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and wetland restoration projects.
